definition[0]: to prevent someone or something from moving
example[0]: The broken limb must be immobilized immediately.
example[1]: She was immobilized with a broken leg.
example[2]: The car’s security device will immobilize the ignition system.
definition[2]: if a company immobilizes its capital, it uses it to buy CAPITAL GOODS (=machinery and equipment that is used to make other goods)
definition[3]: if something immobilizes an organization, machine etc, it prevents it from working
example[3]: A miners’ strike has immobilised all power plants.
